name: Crimson Amber Medallion
caption:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 6%.

name: Crimson Amber Medallion +1
caption:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 7%.

name: Crimson Amber Medallion +2
caption:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 8%.

name: Cerulean Amber Medallion
caption:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> by 7%.

name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +1
caption:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> by 9%.

name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +2
caption:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> by 11%.

name: Viridian Amber Medallion
caption:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 11%.

name: Viridian Amber Medallion +1
caption:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 13%.

name: Viridian Amber Medallion +2
caption:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 15%.

name: Arsenal Charm
caption:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 15%.

name: Arsenal Charm +1
caption:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 17%.

name: Great-Jar's Arsenal
caption:
A charm that resembles a great jar overflowing with weaponry.

The great jar grants this talisman to their warriors. Carry as much as you can—grow big and strong.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 19%.

name: Erdtree's Favor
caption:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 3%, <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 7%, and <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 5%.

name: Erdtree's Favor +1
caption:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 3.5%, <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 8.5%, and <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 6.5%.

name: Erdtree's Favor +2
caption:
A legendary talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 4%, <font color="#E0B985">maximum stamina</font> by 10%, and <font color="#E0B985">maximum equip load</font> by 8%.

name: Radagon's Scarseal
caption:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune.
Said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">vigor</font>, <font color="#E0B985">endurance</font>, <font color="#E0B985">strength</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 3, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 10%.

name: Radagon's Soreseal
caption:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">vigor</font>, <font color="#E0B985">endurance</font>, <font color="#E0B985">strength</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 5, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 15%.

name: Starscourge Heirloom
caption:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale.

The mightiest hero of the demigods confronted the falling stars alone—and thus did he crush them, his conquest sealing the very fate of the stars.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">strength</font> by 5.

name: Prosthesis-Wearer Heirloom
caption:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale.

Though born into the accursed rot, when the young girl encountered her mentor and his flowing blade, she gained wings of unparalleled strength.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 5.

name: Stargazer Heirloom
caption:
A talisman engraved with the legend of a queen.

The young astrologer gazed at the night sky as she walked. She had always chased the stars every step of her journey. Then she met the full moon—and, in time, the astrologer became a queen.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font> by 5.

name: Two Fingers Heirloom
caption:
A talisman engraved with the legend of the Two Fingers.

Fingers cannot speak, yet these were eloquent. Persistently did they wriggle, spelling out mysteries in the air. Thus did we gain the words. The words of our faith.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">faith</font> by 5.

name: Silver Scarab
caption: A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">item discovery</font> by 75.

name: Gold Scarab
caption: A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.
info: Increases runes obtained from defeated enemies by 20%.

name: Moon of Nokstella
caption:
This legendary talisman is a treasure of Nokstella, the Eternal City.

This talisman represents the lost black moon. The moon of Nokstella was the guide of countless stars.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">memory slots</font> by 2, allowing more spells to be memorized.

name: Green Turtle Talisman
caption:
A talisman in the shape of a green turtle.

Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power. However, those who hold turtles to be wise creatures consider the practice of eating their meat to be barbarous.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">stamina regeneration</font> by 8 per second.

name: Stalwart Horn Charm
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font> by 90.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.

name: Stalwart Horn Charm +1
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font> by 140.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.

name: Immunizing Horn Charm
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font> by 90.

<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.

name: Immunizing Horn Charm +1
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font> by 140.

<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.

name: Clarifying Horn Charm
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 90.

<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Clarifying Horn Charm +1
caption:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 140.

<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Prince of Death's Pustule
caption:
A fetid pustule taken from facial flesh.

It is said that this pustule came from the visage of the Prince of Death, he who used to be called Godwyn. As First Dead of the demigods, it's said he's buried deep under the capital, at the Erdtree's roots.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">vitality</font> by 90.

<font color="#E0B985">Vitality:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A17945">death blight</font>.

name: Prince of Death's Cyst
caption:
A fetid, overgrown cyst taken from facial flesh.

It is said that this cyst came from the corrupted visage of one unable to die a true Death. Indeed, it comes from the Prince of Death, scion of the golden bough and First of the Dead among the demigods.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">vitality</font> by 140.

<font color="#E0B985">Vitality:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A17945">death blight</font>.

name: Mottled Necklace
caption:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font>, <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 40.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Mottled Necklace +1
caption:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">robustness</font>, <font color="#E0B985">immunity</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">focus</font> by 60.

<font color="#E0B985">Robustness:</font> Resistance to <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> and <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Immunity:</font> Resistance to <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> and <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font>.
<font color="#E0B985">Focus:</font> Resistance to <font color="#A698F4">sleep</font> and <font color="#EEAA2B">madness</font>.

name: Bull-Goat's Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting the horns of a bull-goat.

Bull-goats are associated with the stout and mighty Tragoth, said to be unflinching in combat—now a silent comrade to those who fight.
info:
Reduces <font color="#E0B985">poise damage received</font> by about 25%.

Although this item shows your poise stat increase by about 34%, this item doesn't actually increase your maximum poise. It only reduces the amount of poise damage that you receive from each attack.

This effect can be combined with the effects of Baldachin's Blessing to reduce <font color="#E0B985">poise damage received</font> by about 50.65%, or it can be combined with the effects of Radiant Baldachin's Blessing to reduce <font color="#E0B985">poise damage received</font> by about 58.75%.

name: Marika's Scarseal
caption:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune.
Said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">mind</font>, <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font>, <font color="#E0B985">faith</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> by 3, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 10%.

name: Marika's Soreseal
caption:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">mind</font>, <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font>, <font color="#E0B985">faith</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> by 5, but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 15%.

name: Warrior Jar Shard
caption:
Shard of a shattered warrior jar.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of ancient royal warriors, perhaps.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of skills by 10%.

name: Shard of Alexander
caption:
Shard of the late Alexander, a shattered warrior jar.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of a red-haired champion, it would seem.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of skills by 15%.

name: Millicent's Prosthesis
caption:
Part of the golden prosthesis used by Millicent. The hand is locked into a fist that once raised a sword aloft.

The despair of sweet betrayal transformed Millicent from a mere bud into a magnificent flower. And one day, she will be reborn—as a beautiful scarlet valkyrie.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 5 and increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> after multiple attacks within a short time. There are 3 tiers of damage increase: 4%, 6%, and 11%.

The number of attacks required to trigger this effect varies per weapon, and is not based on damage or weapon speed. It generally requires 3-4 attacks to trigger the first tier, 5-8 attacks for the second, and 8-11 attacks for the third. Some weapons are too slow to trigger all tiers.

name: Magic Scorpion Charm
caption: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that shimmers with magic.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage inflicted</font> by 12%, but reduces <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10%.

name: Lightning Scorpion Charm
caption: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that sparks with lightning.
info: Increases <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage inflicted</font> by 12%, but reduces <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10%.

name: Fire Scorpion Charm
caption: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that burns with fire.
info: Increases <font color="#F48C25">fire damage inflicted</font> by 12%, but reduces <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10%.

name: Sacred Scorpion Charm
caption: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart with a blessed glow.
info: Increases <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage inflicted</font> by 12%, but reduces <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10%.

name: Red-Feathered Branchsword
caption:
A talisman adorned with red feathers, once used in ancient death rituals.

The heart sings when one draws close to death, and a glorious end awaits those who cling so tenaciously to life.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> by 20% while HP is below 20%.

name: Ritual Sword Talisman
caption:
A talisman patterned after swords used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.

The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> by 10% while HP is at maximum.

name: Spear Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a spear and a soldier.

Spears are standard weapons for soldiers in the Lands Between. They made it possible to respond to a ferocious foe with an equally ferocious counterattack.
info:
Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical attack power</font> of thrusting weapon counter-attacks by 15%.

A counter-attack is performed by hitting an enemy with a thrust attack at a precise time as they are in the process of doing an attack, just before they actually hit you. Not all enemy attacks allow for a counter-attack to be performed.

name: Hammer Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a hammer and a knight.

Hammers are highly effective against shield-bearing foes, so much so that they are known as "knight-killers."
info: Increases the amount of stamina removed with each attack from enemies who are guarding by 20%, making it easier to break their stance.

name: Winged Sword Insignia
caption:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the knights who fought alongside Malenia the Severed.

The wings symbolize Malenia and her undefeated prowess. Though she never knew relief from the accursed rot she was born into, her blade was forever beautiful—and relentless.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> after multiple attacks within a short time. There are 3 tiers of damage increase: 3%, 5%, and 10%.

The number of attacks required to trigger this effect varies per weapon, and is not based on damage or weapon speed. It generally requires 3-4 attacks to trigger the first tier, 5-8 attacks for the second, and 8-11 attacks for the third. Some weapons are too slow to trigger all tiers. Damage bonus resets if no attacks are performed within a short amount of time.

name: Rotten Winged Sword Insignia
caption:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade.
An honor bestowed upon the valkyries who serve the Goddess of Rot.

The four sisters were born in the Swamp of Aeonia, and came to the Haligtree under the aegis of Gowry. And yet, those buds were doomed to never blossom.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> after multiple attacks within a short time. There are 3 tiers of damage increase: 6%, 8%, and 13%.

The number of attacks required to trigger this effect varies per weapon, and is not based on damage or weapon speed. It generally requires 3-4 attacks to trigger the first tier, 5-8 attacks for the second, and 8-11 attacks for the third. Some weapons are too slow to trigger all tiers. Damage bonus resets if no attacks are performed within a short amount of time.

name: Dagger Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a dagger and a surgeon.

The white-garbed field surgeons come to the aid of friend and foe alike by dealing a final deadly thrust to spare them from the prolonged agony of a mortal wound. A sense of mercy is a catalyst for bloodlust.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> for critical attacks by 17%.

name: Arrow's Reach Talisman
caption: A talisman depicting three arrows. Carried by hunters of beasts.
info: Increases the range of arrows, bolts, and some spell projectiles by 65%.

name: Blue Dancer Charm
caption:
A cloth doll depicting a dancer garbed in blue. An ancient heirloom of some sort.

The dancer in blue represents a fairy, who in legend bestowed a flowing sword upon a blind swordsman. Blade in hand, the swordsman sealed away an ancient god—a god that was Rot itself.
info:
Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical attack power</font> by up to 15% based on how low your <font color="#E0B985">equip load</font> is.

This is based on your total equip load, not the percentage compared to your maximum equip load. Increasing your maximum equip load will not improve the effect of this item.

name: Twinblade Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a twinblade and a confessor.

The twinblade technique is a tradition of the confessors, who closely guard the secret of how they preserve the momentum of their attacks. Thus is the final strike of their onslaught all the more deadly.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> for final attack of a chain of regular melee attacks by 45%.

name: Axe Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting an axe and a warrior.

The Lord who led the Long March bore an axe, and his loyal warriors honored him by wielding axes of their own, making them very effective at dealing decisive blows.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of charged melee attacks by 10%.

This effect does not work for charged sorceries, incantations, or weapon skills.

name: Lance Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a lance and a knight.

Knights on horseback are deadly foes. They see all below from their lofty position, meeting little meaningful resistance as they charge ahead.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> by 15% while on horseback.

name: Arrow's Sting Talisman
caption: A talisman depicting three iron arrows. Carried by soldiers long ago.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of arrows and bolts by 10%.

name: Lord of Blood's Exultation
caption:
A talisman depicting the exultation of the Lord of Blood.

"Render up your offerings of blood to your Lord. Drench my consort's chamber. Slake his cocoon's thirst. His awakening shall herald the dawn of our dynasty."
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> by 20% for 20 seconds when <font color="#C84343">blood loss</font> occurs nearby.

name: Kindred of Rot's Exultation
caption:
A talisman depicting the exultation of pests.

"Rot for the scarlet goddess. O scarlet blossoms, flourish in distant lands, and return to us, the unwanted children."
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage inflicted</font> by 20% for 20 seconds when <font color="#40BF40">poison</font> or <font color="#EF7676">scarlet rot</font> occurs nearby.

name: Claw Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a claw and an assassin.

The assassins of Ravenmount are killers by trade. They assail their victims while dressed as birds of prey.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> for jump attacks by 15%.

name: Roar Medallion
caption:
A bronze medallion depicting a roaring giant.

In ancient times, the giants were mortal enemies of the Erdtree. Their bellowing roars desolated nature, triggered avalanches, and whipped up storms of flame.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> for attacks caused or altered by roar and breath skills by 15%.

name: Curved Sword Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a curved sword and a swordsman.

It is said that a blind swordsman was the originator of this technique—the art of allowing one's opponent to strike so as to leave them vulnerable to a well-timed reply.
info:
Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> for guard counters by 20%.

A guard counter is performed by doing a strong attack immediately after blocking an enemy's attack.

name: Companion Jar
caption:
A talisman given by the jars to their friends.

Though the jars are brought to life by human flesh and blood, they are all rather kindly folk. Perhaps they were made to be better than their innards.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of thrown pots by 20%.

name: Perfumer's Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles.

There are gardens known only to the perfumers. Whether hidden on the fringes of the highlands, or obscured by shadows inside caves, the flowers blossom in secret, waiting to impart their scent.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of perfumes by 20%.

name: Graven-School Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting a school of graven mages, the nightmare of the academy.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of sorceries by 4%.

name: Graven-Mass Talisman
caption:
A talisman depicting the first school of graven mages—a nightmare that would continue to haunt the academy.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of sorceries by 8%.

name: Faithful's Canvas Talisman
caption:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a group of masked figures.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of incantations by 4%.

name: Flock's Canvas Talisman
caption:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a mass of masked figures.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of incantations by 8%.

name: Old Lord's Talisman
caption:
A legendary talisman depicting the ancient king whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time.

It is said that the ancient royal city of Farum Azula has been slowly crumbling since time immemorial.
info: Extends the duration of sorcery and incantation effects by 30%.

name: Radagon Icon
caption:
A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Radagon.

As the husband of Rennala of Caria, the red-haired Radagon studied sorcery, and as the husband of Queen Marika, he studied incantations. Thus did the hero aspire to be complete.
info:
Shortens the casting time of sorceries and incantations by the same amount as 30 levels in dexterity.

The shortest casting time is achieved at level 70 dexterity, so this will have no effect after that point.

name: Primal Glintstone Blade
caption:
An old glintstone blade that has been stained with blood.

The old sorcerers would slice open their hearts with these blades to imbue a primal glintstone with their soul, and thus did they die.
info: Reduces FP cost of sorceries and incantations by 25% but reduces <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 15%.

name: Godfrey Icon
caption:
A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Godfrey.

Godfrey was a ferocious warrior. When he vowed to become a lord, he took the Beast Regent Serosh upon his back to suppress the ceaseless lust for battle that raged within.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all attack power</font> of charged sorceries, incantations, and skills by 15%.

name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman
caption:
Wrought iron talisman depicting an ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10%.

name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman +1
caption:
Wrought iron talisman depicting a duo of ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 13%.

name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman +2
caption:
Wrought iron talisman depicting a trio of ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 17%.

name: Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman
caption:
Legendary talisman of wrought iron depicting a massive ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 20%.

name: Spelldrake Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a blue ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magical damage negation</font> by 13%.

name: Spelldrake Talisman +1
caption:
Talisman depicting a duo of blue ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magical damage negation</font> by 17%.

name: Spelldrake Talisman +2
caption:
Talisman depicting a trio of blue ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magical damage negation</font> by 20%.

name: Flamedrake Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a red ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font> by 13%.

name: Flamedrake Talisman +1
caption:
Talisman depicting a duo of red ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font> by 17%.

name: Flamedrake Talisman +2
caption:
Talisman depicting a trio of red ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font> by 20%.

name: Boltdrake Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a yellow ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font> by 13%.

name: Boltdrake Talisman +1
caption:
Talisman depicting a duo of yellow ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font> by 17%.

name: Boltdrake Talisman +2
caption:
Talisman depicting a trio of yellow ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font> by 20%.

name: Haligdrake Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a golden ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 13%.

name: Haligdrake Talisman +1
caption:
Talisman depicting a duo of golden ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 17%.

name: Haligdrake Talisman +2
caption:
Talisman depicting a trio of golden ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 20%.

name: Pearldrake Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a pearlescent ancient dragon.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font>, <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font>, <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font>, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 5%.

name: Pearldrake Talisman +1
caption:
Talisman depicting a duo of pearlescent ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font>, <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font>, <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font>, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 7%.

name: Pearldrake Talisman +2
caption:
Talisman depicting a trio of pearlescent ancient dragons.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.
info: Increases <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font>, <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font>, <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font>, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 9%.

name: Crucible Scale Talisman
caption:
A talisman fashioned from a scale that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

A vestige of the crucible of primordial life. Born partially of devolution, it was considered a signifier of the divine in ancient times, but is now increasingly disdained as an impurity as civilization has advanced.
info: Reduces damage taken from critical attacks by 30%.

name: Crucible Feather Talisman
caption:
A talisman fashioned from feathers that embody the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

A vestige of the crucible of primordial life. Born partially of devolution, it was considered a signifier of the divine in ancient times, but is now increasingly disdained as an impurity as civilization has advanced.
info:
Increases invulnerability duration for dodge rolls but increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 30%.

This effect doesn't stack with the Windy Crystal Tear.

name: Blue-Feathered Branchsword
caption:
A talisman adorned with blue feathers, once used in ancient death rituals.

The heart sings when one draws close to death, and thus does one cling so tenaciously to life—to render up a death worth offering.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage negation</font> by 50% while HP is below 20%.

name: Ritual Shield Talisman
caption:
A talisman patterned after shields used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.

The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage negation</font> by 30% while HP is at maximum.

name: Greatshield Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a knight holding a greatshield.

The knights of Leyndell once modelled themselves after the Tree Sentinels. Their purpose is to protect that which deserves protection, and thus the shield always comes before the sword.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">guard boost</font> by 10%.

name: Crimson Seed Talisman
caption:
A crimson-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed.

The Erdtree was once perfect and eternal, and thus was it believed that Erdtree seeds could not exist.
info: Increases HP restoration from Flask of Crimson Tears by 20%.

name: Cerulean Seed Talisman
caption:
A cerulean-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed.

The Erdtree was once perfect and eternal, and thus was it believed that Erdtree seeds could not exist.
info: Increases FP restoration from Flask of Cerulean Tears by 20%.

name: Blessed Dew Talisman
caption:
Talisman depicting a drop of the Erdtree's sap, a blessed boon.

It was once thought that the blessed sap of the Erdtree would drip from its boughs forever—but that age of plenty swiftly came to a close, and with time, the Erdtree became more an object of faith.
info: Restores 2 HP per second.

name: Taker's Cameo
caption:
A talisman engraved with a stern likeness of Praetor Rykard, master of Volcano Manor.

When Rykard turned to heresy, taking by force became the rule. The gods themselves were no different, after all.
info: Restores 3% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30 when an enemy dies.

name: Godskin Swaddling Cloth
caption:
Sacred cloth of the Godskin Apostles, made from supple skin sewn together.

The Gloam-Eyed Queen cradles newborn apostles swaddled in this cloth. Soon they will grow to become the death of the gods.
info:
Restores 3% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30 after multiple melee attacks within a short time.

The number of attacks required to trigger this effect varies per weapon, but it generally requires 5-7 regular attacks. Heavy attacks, charged attacks, and some weapon skills are also capable of triggering it.

name: Assassin's Crimson Dagger
caption:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in crimson.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.
info: Restores 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 85 after performing a critical attack.

name: Assassin's Cerulean Dagger
caption:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in cerulean.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.
info: Restores 15 FP after a performing a critical attack.

name: Crepus's Vial
caption:
Small mysterious bottle with a dark mist sealed within.

A ritual implement used by Roundtable Hold assassins. There was a time when Tarnished who had strayed from guidance feared nothing more than utter silence.
info: Negates all movement sounds made by the wearer.

name: Carian Filigreed Crest
caption:
A talisman adorned with the royal crest.

An honor said to have once been awarded to Carian knights who served as direct retainers to the kingdom's princesses. Now there is only one princess: Ranni, daughter of Rennala.
info: Reduces FP consumed by skills by 25%.

name: Longtail Cat Talisman
caption:
A brooch depicting Lacrima, the long-tailed cat.

Lacrima features in the fables of Raya Lucaria, in which she is described as a faerie cat who was fond of playing in the great bell tower.
info:
Negates all fall damage.

The height at which a fall is fatal remains the same even while under the effects of this item.

name: Shabriri's Woe
caption:
Disturbing likeness of a man whose eyes have been gouged out. The corners of his mouth are upturned in an almost flirtatious manner.

It is said that the man, named Shabriri, had his eyes gouged out as punishment for the crime of slander, and, with time, the blight of the flame of frenzy came to dwell in the empty sockets.
info:
Online multiplayer item.

Makes enemies more likely to attack you rather than an online co-op partner. Has no effect in single player.

name: Daedicar's Woe
caption:
Disturbing likeness of a woman whose skin was flayed. She smiles with a serene tenderness.

It is said that this woman, named Daedicar, indulged in every form of adultery and wicked pleasure imaginable, giving birth to a myriad of grotesque children.
info: Increases <font color="#E0B985">all damage received</font> by 100%.

name: Furled Finger's Trick-Mirror
caption:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects an image of a golden figure.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.
info:
Online multiplayer item.

Makes you take on the appearance of a Host of Fingers.

name: Host's Trick-Mirror
caption:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.
info:
Online multiplayer item.

Makes you take on the appearance of a summoned cooperator.

name: Entwining Umbilical Cord
caption: Mysterious circular object that's oddly warped.
info: Changes demeanour of your actions. Masculine characters wearing this will use feminine animations, and feminine characters wearing this will use masculine animations.

name: Ancestral Spirit's Horn
caption:
Item cut from the horns of the Regal Ancestor Spirit.

A number of new growths bud from the antler-like horns of the fallen king, each glowing with light. Thus does new life grow from death, and from death, one obtains power.
info: Restores 3 FP when an enemy dies.
